thread.title: Lakewood warm-ups honor late star Mackenzie Forrest
thread.title_full: Lakewood warm-ups honor late star Mackenzie Forrest

author: Kyle Newman
title: Lakewood warm-ups honor late star Mackenzie Forrest
text: Rodney Billups roots on alma mater while scoping out talent March 11, 2017, 6:56 pm University of Denver coach Rodney Billups took in the 4A and 5A championship games Saturday at the Denver Coliseum in an appearance that was part business, part pleasure. Lamar defeats Colorado Springs Christian in rubber match for 3A girls basketball title March 11, 2017, 6:36 pm The Savages fought through a slow start and overcame familiarity to knock off Colorado Springs Christian 24-18 for their first 3A girls basketball championship since 1998. Seniors Kayle Knuckles, Jalen Sanders lead Valor Christian to first boys basketball championship March 11, 2017, 6:04 pm Kayle Knuckles didn’t play his first organized basketball game until ninth grade. In the hyper-competitive world of youth basketball, he was like a 65-year-old who had waited until retirement to learn how to drive. He may have had a late start, but the 6-foot-6 senior forward for Valor Christian ended his career in grand fashion, scoring a career-high 32 points... Evergreen holds off Pueblo South in Class 4A girls for program’s first state championship March 11, 2017, 4:50 pm Evergreen posted a wire-to-wire victory over Pueblo South on Saturday in the Class 4A girls basketball championship at the Denver Coliseum, with sophomore Claudia Dillon’s 11 points pacing the Cougars to an 45-35 victory and the program’s first state title.
